channel.description: This is pretty sad: [url]https://www.joystiq.com/2010/02/28/activision-shuts-down-fan-made-kings-quest-sequel/[/url] The Activision money train once again takes a dagger the the gaming community that has made them successful. In 2005, fans successfully convinced Vivendi to allow the indie team behind The Silver Lining to continue development, thanks in part to a letter writing campaign. [/quote]

Well, id DID release a web browser compatible, freeware version of Quake 3 called “Quake LIVE.” Perhaps that had something to do with why they shut down the mod. In id’s defense, bear in mind that they’re GPLing their engine techs. Wonder what will happen to the modding community when id Tech 4 gets GPLed.

Might be interesting to see what pops up. After all, check out “Nexuiz-” That game is running on modified id Tech 3 code and it’s graphics are actually quite competitive with other freeware engines like Saurbraten.

My guess is because Activision have plans for the series, and didn’t want a non commercial fan-made game to steal their thunder. It would be congruent with their plans for acquiring the franchise an’ all.

Pretty much the same thing that LucasArts did with the Monkey Island series. IIRC, there was a team that proposed to do a remake of the series, but it was shut down by LA shortly after they began. A few months/years later and bam, new games and remade versions of the old ones hit the virtual shelves.

item.title: Activision shuts down fan-made King's Quest sequel
item.dc:creator: AzzX
item.description:
Fair enough, I must be getting to old to have to explain Kings Quest

What is King’s Quest?

King’s Quest is Sierra On-Line’s flagship series of adventure games, designed by the award-winning Roberta Williams. It centers on the adventures of the royal family of the Kingdom of Daventry, and combines memorable characters, often mind-bending puzzles, great storylines, and fun gameplay. Most of the puzzles and many of the characters are inspired by myth and folklore, making the games easy to enjoy for anyone who plays them.

What is “The Silver Lining”?

“The Silver Lining” is the fan-designed ninth episode inspired by the King’s Quest series.

From the Silver Lining Home

Recently, however, ownership of the Sierra IP changed hands and became the property of Activision. After talks and negotiations in the last few months between ourselves and Activision, they have reached the decision that they are not interested in granting a non-commercial license to The Silver Lining, and have asked that we cease production and take down all related materials on our website.

Its just concerning the implications this could have on other fan inspired creations. I am sure Valve would never take this route though the possibility remains nonetheless.
